[h1]《魔幻银英：群星之巅》[/h1]
+等等，魔幻？果然，进入游戏后发现是一款结合RPG元素的飞行射击实验作？应该分类为R.STG或者Shooting.RPG，子弹射中目标跳出伤害数值，越发给人以传统RPG的感觉。
=3D建模，2D卷轴，美工尚可。
+单人体验一般，多人模式却像换了一个游戏，乐趣倍增！主副武器通用可选，5位主角主动技能各有特色：
蓝鹰：射击型，追踪飞弹齐射——龙骑兵系统多重锁定。
红虎：近战型，减速世界——5秒间所有敌人减速约90%。
银狼：平衡型，音速之翼（啥效果来着？无存在感的角色）
黑熊：防御型，无敌圣盾——自身5秒间可以弹飞所有敌人子弹。
琥珀狐：进攻支援型，羊角兽之吻，麻痹所有敌人约5秒，应该还有伤害提升加成？
+被动属性强化：
机甲基础有6种属性——射击，近战，血量，护盾，防御，暴击率，过小关可以选择某项升一级。
过大关之后会有一个滑稽的贩卖机器人，结算获得的CR可以用来购买升级物品，除了基础提升，还可能出现蓝紫金品质的稀有配件！更滑稽的是，你还能花1000cr刷新商店……滑稽到哭啊！
+关卡开始的时候可以自由选择各种参数，调整难度，诸如子弹的速度、密集程度，伤害、血量、护盾、物品掉落的倍率，没学好英语玩不好游戏系列。
=剧情，同上，看不懂的话……鸡肋。
=操作，娱乐向，判定不是很严格，更适合用手柄。

总评：8.0/10.0
4人可以达到9.0，单人会跌到6.0，哈哈哈，然而只有本地多人……底子不错，希望以后出中文以及联机。

35017906.review:
This is a side-scrolling shoot 'em up. It's nothing innovative. There's not wrinkle. But for what it is, it's very good.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

You're either the kind of person who loves this type of game or you don't. If you hate shoot 'em ups, avoid. If you [i]want[/i] to like shoot 'em ups, but are looking for a suitable entry point, this is your game. Yes, it's a bullet hell and much of the skill comes from hitting and not getting hit. Unlike traditional shoot 'em ups, you don't have to start from the beginning when you lose. You don't even run out of continues. You keep going until you beat the level or decide you've had enough. 

One benefit in this game is the local co-op multi-player. You can have up to four people playing with you at once. And it's a blast.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

The graphics won't wow you, but they're pretty. The polygons remind me of the PS1/PS2 era of gaming. The look reminds me of anime, which shouldn't surprise you since you're playing a mech. While you won't mistake this as having a "retro" look, it is definitely nostalgic. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]

The music is a high point as it should be since at once point you're fighting a [spoiler]giant disco ball[/spoiler]. Regarding the sound effects, the best it can be described is as "arcade-y". It's fun!

[h1]Hardware Optimization[/h1]

I've tested this game on a variety of hardware: an i7 tower with a GTX 1050 Ti running Windows, a Thinkpad T440p running Ubuntu with integrated graphics, and an HP Stream 11 running Windows with integrated graphics. It runs with flying colours on all three. It runs well with low and hi resolution graphics. If you bought virtually any new computer within the past 5 years, you should be able to run this.

[h1]Value[/h1]

I bought this in a bundle, so I didn't pay anywhere near the full price. That said, the value largely wrests on who you are. If you're an old hand at shoot 'em ups, you could probably find cheaper games that scratch that itch. However, if you're looking for a good game to buy a child, or are just looking for short co-op action with a friend, then this is well worth the money.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

It was a fun few hours that I spent with this game. The graphics and sound were nice. Though there's nothing innovative going on with this game, the formula works. Certainly some people might find this too easy, but then again, hard shoot 'em ups are plentiful. Score: 4/5

33165336.review:
【总评】7.5/10

【优点】

丰富的机体。远程型、近战型、灵动型、防御型、攻击性，可根据自己的需要灵活选择。

有趣的特殊能力。每种机体都有两种个性的特殊能力，用途各异，为游戏添彩不少。

不可或缺的子机。游戏途中可临时获得各种能力的子机，给玩家攻关带来很大帮助。

舒服的弹幕设计和碰撞判定。使得躲避弹幕成为一种享受。

可自动射击。使玩家把精力放在弹幕、近战、技能等需要动脑子的地方。而不必浪费在手动按射击键，这种即单调又累人的操作上。

体贴休闲玩家。可自动恢复的护盾大大降低了游戏难度，休闲玩家也能轻松通关。

自由的难度设定。玩家可以自己调整数十项难度参数，自由定制游戏难度。

RPG升级设计。可以用游戏中打来的点数购买各种升级部件，以提升机体能力，增强了玩家刷刷刷的动力。

【缺点】

缺少地形设计。没有横版STG惯有的地形设计，每关只是背景和敌人不同。

不能更改键位。玩家不能设置自己喜欢的键位。

不支持非360手柄。使用老式手柄和摇杆的玩家，被制作组无视了。

不平衡的设计。如：机体特殊能力不均衡，有的太强，有的鸡肋。

呆板的自机武器。虽有多种自机武器可供选择，但设计呆板，部分武器有同质化问题。

非花式弹幕。想看到东方系STG漂亮花式弹幕的朋友，恐怕会失望。

【总结】

非常优秀的横版弹幕型STG。如果制作组能有更多时间打磨，这款作品有机会成为神作。但在成本和销量的现实压力下，只能抱憾了。

31205407.review:
Aqui um guia que eu fiz para as conquistas: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=915003846
Esse jogo é fantástico, pena que é muito mal otimizado. Meu PC não é dos melhores, mas a maioria dos jogos desse tipo eu consigo jogar na resolução 1920x1080 com os gráficos na configuração média. Esse jogo ficou lento mesmo com os gráficos na configuração mais baixa, por isso tive que baixar a resolução pra 1366x768 e manter a qualidade baixa pra conseguir jogar direitinho.
Mas valeu muito a pena! Junto com o Sky Force, são os melhores jogos nesse estilo que encontrei aqui no Steam.
É possível jogar em até 4 jogadores na mesma tela (eu joguei com mais duas pessoas). São 5 robôs pra escolha, cada um com características próprias e um especial próprio (botão B) focado nessas características.
Possui várias armas primárias e secundárias pra escolha livre e que podem ser trocadas ao final de cada fase.
Tem um vasto sistema de aprimoramento que pode ser equilibrado ou focado em determinadas características (resistência, dano, cura, etc).
A dificuldade de jogo é totalmente customizável, podendo ser configurada para bem fácil, pra quem quiser só se divertir e finalizar o jogo em poucas horas ou pra uma dificuldade insana, pra quem curte desafios e gosta de odiar os jogos morrendo várias vezes.
É muito legal jogar com mais gente, mas sozinho também é muito divertido.
O controle do Xbox 360 funcionou perfeitamente pra esse jogo, sendo que não sei como é a jogabilidade com o teclado ou com outros gamepads.
A primeira fase do jogo no modo campanha só tem rochas pra destruir, isso é para os jogadores testarem as armas e se acostumarem com os botões.
Em três jogadores, nós finalizamos a campanha em aproximadamente 3 horas na dificuldade normal. O jogo tem um sistema de ressuscitamento pra quando um jogador morre e os outros continuam vivos, é só chegar perto do que morreu e ficar apertando Y repetidamente até a barra vermelha sumir, quanto mais gente ajudar, mais rápido ele ressuscita (e ainda tem um aprimoramento pra ressuscitar jogadores mais rapidamente) por isso quanto mais gente jogar, mais fácil e rápido fica de zerar o jogo.
Depois de terminado o modo campanha existem outros modos de jogo (incluindo um "modo infinito") e uma quantidade grande de conquistas, algumas bem difíceis. O slot de salvamento fica aberto para jogar quantas campanhas quiser e a dificuldade do jogo pode ser alterada a qualquer momento. Os aprimoramentos serão mantidos quando a campanha for reiniciada no mesmo slot.
Nenhum de nós sabia inglês direito, por isso nem acompanhamos a história e passamos o texto bem rápido, sem ler. Certamente deve ser bem mais divertido ler os textos com calma e entender o que se passa na história, no final percebemos que ela é até bem humorada. Espero que surja uma tradução futuramente.
A trilha sonora é legalzinha até, nada demais.
Os gráficos são ótimos, mesmo na qualidade e resolução baixas.
Eu comprei com 50% de desconto, mas pagaria o valor cheio se tivesse jogado antes no pc de um amigo. Esse jogo vale cada centavo.

30763157.review:
This is a wonderful shoot-em-up game with a campaign mode that is unfortunately too short, but there is quite a bit of replay value if you are a completionist. There is also the gauntlet mode which is very similar to endless, but I have yet to reach the end of a gauntlet, at this point in time, to know if it is endless or not. 

You get to play 5 different mechs that each have their own unique capabilities and suitabilities to how you play. A decent variety of weapon for you to choose from and each having their own pros and cons. Having tried all the mechs and different variations of each weapon, I definitely know I prefer a certain combination of weapons compared to others. The base stats are all the same for each mech and all the upgrades will apply to the mech you select before the start of the campaign. Some of the upgrades are interesting and quite helpful depending on if you are playing solo or co-op. Because it's a couch co-op game, it'll most likely be a solo campaign for me most of the time so a few upgrades are not as high priority for me than others. 

The game's music is very nice and I think carries the right beats and mood for each stage in the campaign. While there is a very minimal story plot in this game, it was amusing to progress through the game with it, but definitely not story-rich. The context did make me a laugh a bit, but that's about it. (It's a shoot-em-up game, take it for what it is!)

I think the custom difficulty adds a nice touch to the game. Haven't tried it yet, but being able to customize the game's difficulty would make the game appeal more to a much wider variety of gamers - aside from the preset difficulties in the game.

Overall, I did finish the game once on sunday stroll mode just to learn the game and practice how I want to play before the harder modes. Definitely will go back and forth playing this game between others to complete all the upgrades and maybe unlock all the achievements. 8.5/10!

哦活活，我又是中文评测第一人。

一直以来，都对机甲游戏很感兴趣，一看打了小折马上入手了。

游戏属于横版STG，第一眼感觉就很华丽，各种光线武器特效Duang，Duang，Duang亮瞎狗眼。

游戏一共有5个机体可以选。机甲远能射，近能砍；每个机体都有专属技能，比如1号蓝色机，X键远距离投掷标枪，B键气槽满后是导弹齐射；2号红色机，X键是爪击（按住不放会越来越快）B键气槽满后是时间缓慢；很明显一号偏远程，2号偏近战。3号能瞬移，4号能防御，5号能吸收子弹，看玩家喜欢哪种风格了，自由选择。不过根据我自己的经验，如果没基友配合，单人流程还是第一台蓝色机甲最好用。远距离标枪攒气比较快也安全，导弹齐射自动跟踪，后期能力提升后导弹齐射一次后还能短时间提升武器性能，在高难度下非常实用。
PS:游戏设计很贴心，如果你是用手柄玩的，RT跟LT键分别对应游戏的主、副武器，如果你点一下RB或者LB键，对应的武器就会变成全自动射击，你只需要专注躲子弹或者近战砍就行了，这点设计非常好。（游戏到后面你就会知道自动射击真是太贴心了）

每关开始都能选择一个主武器，一个副武器；武器种类繁多，从格林机枪到脉冲激光，从狙击步枪到跟踪导弹，应有尽有。玩家可以根据自己喜好随意搭配。每个小关或者游戏大关，可以购入各种能力提升（可惜全英文，很多能力都不是太明白）强化机体，应付越来越难的关卡。提升的能力是所有机体共享，尝试不同机甲通关的乐趣吧。

进入游戏后，机甲左方的蓝槽是护盾，能抵消伤害，也能慢慢回复；绿色的是生命值，护盾没了再受伤害就会减少，到零就over，可以在游戏中吃绿色的药箱恢复；下方的是气槽，满了就可以发动特殊攻击。另外提醒一下，近战武器加的气比射击加的快得多（第一台蓝色机甲的远程长矛也属于武器攻击，气也加得比较快）能近战的机会就绝不要放过。游戏途中能吃到各种暂时提升武器性能的宝物，威力全面提升，视觉效果也是duang，duang的不行。尽量多击破敌方机体吧。

游戏的难度挺大的，后期几乎是满屏子弹，护盾咣咣几下就能破掉。不同难度下boss的攻击方式，行动轨迹完全不一样，打得异常艰难。幸好游戏机甲的受创判定还是比较小的，穿子弹缝隙是常有的事。另外提醒一点，宁愿吃子弹也别吃激光，伤害非常大。还有虽然是横板STG，但是被陨石，障碍物，敌方大型机体卡住也是会被卡死的。

目前我只通关了normal 难度，通关后提取存档能保留所有能力重新游戏，但是难度似乎也提升了一个等级。看来要能力全满得叫上基友一起来了。

总之是个好玩的游戏，推荐入手。对了，忘记游戏一个最大优点，可以四人同乐哦，快去找基友一起爽吧。

This game is super fun.  I gave it a shot after the creator did a great AMA on Reddit, and I was so surprised at how fun this game is.  Also...OS X support...that is so amazing.  Feels bad when a fun game comes out with no OS X port.

This game is very much a spiritual successor to R-Type, but without the terrible frame rate drops that the original Rtype had (from the Sega Genesis era).

Super fun game, very much worth the $9usd.

25488051.review: Cool game, I like it. Reminds me of Gradius.

25485433.review:
Not bad, considering this is their first game.  The soundtrack is great, the choice for weapons is nice, enemy variety is nice, but it really shows that this is their first game  Level progression is different backgrounds with enemies flying towards you in waves.  There's even an endless wave mode you can play, which is nice to have.  Bosses are okay.  They aren't amazing, but they aren't bad.  Overall, for their first shmup, it's passable.  I feel I got my money's worth, though I also somewhat feel the soundtrack is as valuable as the game.  The amount of options with regards to customizing the game is also nice, but I feel in the end it may have hurt them as I would rather have a very polished single form game than an unpolished "you can do anything" game.  The story is stupid, but I enjoyed it because it was self aware.  However, nowadays, the "I hold up my spork" kind of random stories are a dime a dozen.

That said, I feel there is a lack of polish on some things, which I imagine occurred due to this game being an amalgamation of ideas and the little bumps haven't been ironed out.  The many pieces of the game don't really fit together.  They're just...there.  Like the different mech's special attacks.  Largely unneeded as it's better to prioritize shooting your main weapon.  The game needs focus.

This game is not a slow moving bullet hell like touhou (which I am glad for, as I do not enjoy that game), it's not a score/coin reward game like giga wing, and it's also not a strong level progression game like r-type or jamestown (though jamestown is a mix of story and coins, which was very highly polished).

I think that its main problem.  It's not quite sure what it wants to be.  Numbers pop up like crazy, so is it a reward kinda game?  There's no coins, so my brain's reward center isn't happy.  Level progression is lame and consists of different enemies on a slow moving background.  There's no level elements like barriers or a finely detailed background that goes along with the enemies.  At times it is a fast moving bullet hell game, which is great as the recharging shield mechanic makes the game frantic, but it's missing that polish to tie it all together.

The stupid story is kind of the epitome of this game - forgetable.  But, it's ten dollars forgetable, and most importantly, it's not bad, so I feel I more than got my money's worth out of it.  If they make a sequel I would be very highly interested, provided the above points were addressed.

25477577.review:
I recently finished this updated version of Stardust Galaxy Warriors and I have to say Dreamloop really knocked it out of the park. 

If you like SHMUPs with RPG elements, I don't think it gets much better than this, especially considering all of the customization options you have with your characters and the game itself. The game customization is on par with Madden in terms of controlling your players and your enemy's actions.

This edition balances the combat, adds a new character, Amber Fox and overhauls the graphics. I highly recommend it. 

Did I mention SGW:SC has one of the dopest soundtracks I've heard in a good long while?

Here's footage from the first level of play - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0nGAhtXZc4

25373091.review:
Ce jeu a été une excellente surprise, je l’ai pris cet été pour jouer en coop local, ça a plu à tout le monde et c’était vraiment super. Mieux encore, même en solo, je me suis régalé ! Puis, le 9 septembre est arrivé la version Stellar Climax. J’ai testé cette nouvelle version environ 6h30 et au final, je suis plutôt déçu. La précédente mouture était meilleure tant en terme de visibilité que de sensation de puissance dans le mode campagne. [u]Toutefois, le jeu reste très fun et je le recommande toujours aussi chaudement, tant pour jouer en solo qu’en coop local ![/u] Je vais commencer mon évaluation par le négatif et ferai souvent référence à l’ancienne version.

[u]Le négatif :[/u]
-[u]Pas de tutoriel:[/u] Embêtant car le layout n’est présenté que quand on met la pause, si on ne sait pas ça, on cherche les boutons tout seul et ça finit par le faire mais quand même, j’aurais bien aimé un petit tuto.
-[u]Quelques problèmes de visibilité:[/u] Les décors sont certes plus beaux mais masquent parfois certains ennemis à l’apparence terne en comparaison et même certains projectiles sont moins faciles à repérer !
-[u]L’aléatoire du magasin d’aptitudes:[/u] Certes il peut être reset autant de fois qu’on le désire (pour quelques points à chaque fois) mais même ainsi il tarde parfois à donner les aptitudes passives que l’on désire pour faire son build.
-[u]Une sensation de puissance diminuée en mode campagne: [/u] Le magasin de fin de mission ne propose plus les mêmes améliorations passives et évidemment les plus abusives n’y sont plus ([u]adieu la sensation de cracher du feu comme un dragon, soit avec power-up, un jet de flamme x6 qui remplit une partie de l’écran[/u]). Avant si on voulait faire sans ces améliorations passives abusives, il suffisait d’aller en Gauntlet ou simplement de faire la campagne sans les prendre. Au final, avec cette nouvelle version, je m’attendais à de nouvelles aptitudes passives, des trucs funs pour faire un run pété à la Biding of Isaac, comme avant mais en mieux, bah non et c’est bien dommage.
-[u]Trop de power-up tue le power-up:[/u] Ils sont plus nombreux qu’avant mais c’est un souci car on drope plus rarement ceux que l’on souhaite comme le triple tir qui permet presque de remplir l’écran mais pas longtemps. Le pire c’est que selon les passages on peut avoir beaucoup de power-up comme quasi aucun d’un gros moment, c’est trop déséquilibré à ce niveau.

[u]Le positif:[/u]
+[u]Du coop local jusqu’à 4:[/u] On peut faire un mix entre manettes et clavier/souris (on peut aussi jouer uniquement avec la souris, il y a une option pour ça, par contre, ça met le robot en auto-fire). Toutefois, on ne peut pas reconfigurer les touches que ce soit manettes ou clavier/souris. Et comme dans certains jeux, la difficulté augmente avec le nombre de joueur.
+[u]5 robots jouables et plusieurs armes:[/u] Chacun possède deux aptitudes uniques (une spéciale, lançable souvent et une ultime, lançable plus rarement car très puissante) ainsi qu’une arme principale et une arme secondaire à choisir (parmi 7 dans les deux cas) à chaque début de mission.
+[u]Une bonne palette de coups:[/u] Le tir de l’arme principal, celui de l’arme secondaire (les deux peuvent être activés en même temps), une attaque au CàC (on ne peut pas tirer en même temps), l’aptitude spéciale et l’aptitude ultime.
+[u]Auto-fire activable et désactivable:[/u] Une touche pour chaque arme.
+[u]3 modes de jeu:[/u] Un mode Campagne (le mode histoire en gros), un mode Gauntlet (le but est de survivre à des vagues d’ennemis dont la puissance augmente avec le temps, c’est un mode sans fin) et un mode Challenge (qui contient notamment un challenge boss rush). Tous sont jouables en coop local jusqu’à 4.
+[u]Une difficulté ajustable par le joueur:[/u] On peut customiser la partie que l’on va faire (possible en mode Campagne et Gauntlet uniquement). Ainsi, on peut devenir très fort ou très faible ou alors rendre les ennemis très forts ou très faibles ou faire un mix de tout ça, il y a vraiment beaucoup d’options, c’est une possibilité d’ajustement que je trouve très sympathique !
+[u]Une personnalisation de son robot durant le mode campagne et à plusieurs chacun améliore son robot comme il l’entend:[/u] On peut améliorer ses caractéristiques de base (dégâts, résistances aux dégâts etc.) et il y a des aptitudes passives à débloquer (avant elles pouvaient changer la façon de jouer, maintenant, beaucoup moins, il reste quand même quelques spécialisations possibles mais c’est plus léger).
+[u]Un mode new game+ pour la campagne:[/u] Ce mode permet de conserver ses caractéristiques et ses améliorations passives. C’est une super idée mais je doute qu’on finisse par se sentir surpuissant comme avant et pour moi, c’est un point négatif, je n’ai pas envie de faire et refaire la campagne sans belle carotte à la clef (on peut acheter amélioration une fois qu’on a toutes les caractéristiques à fond, la Stardust Emblem mais je ne suis guère tenté).
+[u]Une autre sensation de puissance: [/u] Pour revenir sur les power-up, dans les nouveaux, il y a les drones, on ne peut en avoir qu’un à la fois, le drone se fixe à notre robot durant un certain temps et en plus on peut avoir un autre power-up en même temps, ce qui donne une nouvelle sensation de puissance, c’est pas mal mais ça ne vaut pas l’ancienne sensation, notamment parce qu’il arrive qu’on n’ait aucun power-up d’un gros moment. Par contre, ça améliore le Gauntlet !
+[u]Tout n’a pas été altéré en mal:[/u] En effet, à part pour les soucis de visibilité, le Gauntlet et le mode Challenge n’ont que peu changé puisqu’on n’avait pas accès au magasin de fin de mission et qu’ils bénéficient des drones et cie. Il y a le nouveau robot et d’autres changements plutôt intéressants. En plus, il y a eu diverses corrections de bugs etc. donc du bon quand même.
+[u]Certains boss ont changé:[/u] En effet, certains ont des comportements différents dont un qui m’a clairement surpris dans mon essai du Gauntlet sur cette version, il m’a d’ailleurs tué… ça, par contre, j’ai adoré, c’était une surprise intéressante !
+[u]Des nouveaux checkpoints:[/u] Il y a des checkpoints avant chaque boss, avant, il fallait se refaire le stage du boss et heureusement car avec la difficulté accrue par les différents changements énoncés plus haut ça aurait pu être un truc de dingue. Par exemple, en Iron Man avec Black Bear, j’ai eu beaucoup de mal sur certains boss et refaire à chaque fois les stages avec le risque d’arriver amoché, non merci, j’aime bien avoir du challenge dans un jeu mais à ce stade ça n’aurait pas été pour moi.
+[u]Diversité et rejouabilité:[/u] Au final, tout ça apporte une bonne diversité et une bonne rejouabilité au titre pour peu que l’on aime ce qu’il propose.
+[u]Durée de vie de la campagne:[/u] Au final, les changements apportés au magasin du mode campagne rendent celle-ci clairement plus difficile et donc plus longue.
La campagne contient 9 missions découpées en 3 stages chacune et un boss final réparti sur 3 stages. Avant il fallait compter ~2 heures en normal pour finir la campagne une première fois, maintenant, je ne sais pas trop, ~2 heures m’ont été nécessaire pour finir la campagne en normal avec le nouveau robot.
+[u]Musiques et bruitages:[/u] Les musiques sont bien agréables, pêchues et s’intègrent bien au jeu. Les bruitages aussi sont très bons, ce qui n’est pas toujours le cas dans ce type de jeu.

Bought this game during the Summer sale with the intention to play this co-op. Played through it in one sitting with friends and man, this was a fun game. The campaign is short, but that seems typical for bullet hells.

23639051.review:
SGW is a fun mech shoot 'em up. There are many difficulty levels, on top of which you can customize from many options your difficulty level (e.g. how much health, how big hitbox you have, how many power-up drops, etc.). So if you fear that you are not good at shmups, no problem! If you on the other hand have great amount of experience of playing shmups, no problem either! Want to play this casually alone or with friends? Want to rack up high scores on a proper challenge? Customize the difficulty to suit your needs.

Graphics are nice, music and fx are great. There is variation in guns; there are for example chaingun, plasma shotgun and my favourite, flamethrower! There are 4 mechs, each with their own special abilities. My favourite is Black Bear, she has a shield which brings great joy if you manage to use it right and bounce enemy fire right back at them. Also, the mechs have badass swords. I can't but wonder, why this game isn't more popular, it really is really good. The story mode even has great humour, made a big smile on my face many times. After you beat story, there are Gauntlet mode and many Challenges to extend the lifespan of this game.

Haven't had chance to try the co-op, I expect it to be awesome, since the game is awesome even playing by yourself!

I really can't think of any negative sides about this game. This really isn't anything ground breaking (how many shmups are, on the other hand?), as you probably wouldn't expect, but a very neat (and most of all FUN) mecha shmup! Well worth the price. If on discount, it is a must-buy if you ever have thought of playing a shmup.

22927063.review:
Short campaign, long replayability.

Difficulty:
Each campaign section had its own enemies with their own weapon patterns. But the inclusion of an upgrade shop made the enemies too easy, right? Well then you crank up the enemy health to 300%, enemy fire rate 300%, and your own health to 20% to get a true bullet hell experience. This creates absolute chaos and I love it.

Story:
It's a pretty standard story with plots of alien rulers, missing ships, etc. Characters are not memorable, but their design adds a charm to the game. The writing however, is pretty funny.

Visuals:
Unlike the characters, the environments were all very unique with enemies to match. Underwater enemies actually look like they belong underwater. The space environments look pretty wicked, and the projectiles are flashy and feel like they belong in a bright, chaotic space battle.

Music:
If you like upbeat, intense electronica, then you'll like this.

On to the game itself. This appears to be a co-op bullet hell that you can customize the experience of. The graphics are crisp, the music is catchy, and it looks to support both K&M and Xbox style controllers (based on the graphics shown, though I admit I don't have a Dualshock 4 to test with).

On my system, (2600K @ 4.3Ghz, 16GB DDR3 1600 CL9, and a GTX 980) it runs beautifully at 2560x1440, I can't detect any framerate drops, but I'm also using a G-Sync monitor.

Character selection is small, but the items within them are significant, I look forward to pressing on and figuring out what my favorite options are.

Back to the Galaxy I go now!

SFロボットシューティング。
昔のアニメにありそうなSF物の世界観。
でも、そんなの分からなくても問題ない。
だってシューティングゲームだから。

先ず機体を4種類の中から選ぶ。
これによって、各機体固有の動作が決まる。
特殊格闘攻撃とディストーションと呼ばれる一発技（一般的にボムと言われている物）がこれに当たる。
その後、主・副の射撃武器を選ぶ。
それぞれ主兵装が7種類、副兵装が7種類ある。
これに全機体共通の通常格闘攻撃が加わって、4つの攻撃方法を駆使していく。
組み合わせで難易度が大きく変わるのは良くある話。

道中はアイテムを拾って一時的にパワーアップや回復ができる。
また、キャンペーンモードではボス戦後にアップグレードもある。
中身は様々で基本能力（LVの概念有り）が6種類、特殊な物（LVの概念無し）が28種類（もっとあるかも）。
無難な物から、癖の強い物まで色々ある。
やはり組み合わせで難易度が大きく変わるのは良くある話。

難易度設定も項目が18種類、難易度ランクも完全カスタマイズを含め10階級。

ちょっと・・・いや非常に残念なのがオンラインCOOPがない事。
ローカルCOOPだけってのがきつい。
味方の復活や、フレンドリファイヤー（関係する実績有り）の設定なんかCOOPじゃなければ意味が無い。
ボッチさんはどうしろって言うんだ。

結論：それでも、充分遊べるとは思います。

ガイドに最低限必要な事に関しては日本語訳を置いています。
上記の武器、パワーアップ、アップグレードなどの説明も翻訳しています。

This is an excellent sidescrolling single-player or co-op shmup. I have only played solo so far. I imagine with 4 people playing the action is quite hectic. You select a mech and have several loadout choices for each mission. Missions are done in three stages, at the completion of each stage you are awarded a choice between 3 upgrades that improve attack power, defense, shield regeneration or the speed you acquire special attacks. At the completion of a mission you can spend your mission bonus to buy more upgrades from a vendor. 

Controls are very tight and the game is well-balanced, not over-the-top difficulty like some of the borderline sado-masochistic shmups you can find on Steam. 

Overall lots of fun and worth considering in a genre that is filled with good options.

This is not a review of the game, it's a comment on the Dev team. 

I mentioned to the Dev that I love games like this, but being hemiplegic limits me to only being able to play games that have mouse-movement. It was just an offhanded (pun) comment to explain a question I posted. 

Two days later, the Devs sent me a message saying they were able to add a way to use mouse movement. [b][u]They rewrote their game's control scheme just so I could play.[/u][/b] 

When people  talk about contact they've had with Devs, it's very often negative, highlighting garbage games, dishonest forum activities, scams in Greenlight, etc. That stuff makes it easy to forget that there are some who genuinely care about the quality of their game and about customer support. 

Somebody who would go out of their way like this, unsolicited, for a single potential customer...  you can't beat that.

19220367.review:
Pros:
* Mechs have well defined roles (tank, ranged dps, melee dps, and evasion) which allows for synergy between players (tanks deflecting bullets and making everyone invincible to help those who are less familiar with this type of arcade-style game, sniper marking targets to take more damage from all sources, melee dps slowing time for everyone, ...)
* Good amount of customization between picking a mech, a main weapon, and a sub weapon, which are all available immediately. Also frequent upgrades (usually 2) in the middle of levels that allow you to build towards your defined style (such as being a sniper and picking up crit upgrades) as well as a shop at the end of each level that allows for spending points towards more upgrades.
* Tons of game customization (enemy durability, player shot speed, hibox radiuses, spawn rate, fire rate... just about all low level manipulation you can think of). Lots of presets available, so you can easily switch between 5 difficulties' worth of settings, as well as extra presets like "Iron Man" where you have 0% shield multiplier.
* Lots of environments - from frozen skies to exploding suns, underwater wrecks to alien hives, gas giants to robot factories, there's 10 locations in all with quite a bit of variety.
* Can jump right in with the gauntlet mode - basically a never-ending mode (well, until you die) where you go for the high score.

Cons:
* Story dialogue / plot is seemingly intentionally bad, but just ends up being unfunny and adding very little. Anime avatars for the characters seem a bit out of place. Wish I could turn it off entirely.
* Would really benefit from having online multiplayer (as well as would probably sell a ton more copies. I know I'd be able to get some more friends to play it with me if it had online).
* Achievements would be a nice touch, as it would give me more reason to play and try out all the mechs / weapons solo (and more reason to spend time in gauntlet mode).

Other:
* Pretty quick game - around 2-3 hours. Want to call this a con, but can be a pro if you have trouble spending lots of time with friends after school/work since this game only has local co-op - it does mean you can beat this game in one sitting though, from start to finish.
* Music is ok (opinion), although if I bought the soundtrack it'd probably only be for a few tracks (namely the last boss ones, because that fight had multiple phases and is pretty exciting)

Update Feb 2016 - it does look like they are listening to users, and they added a bunch of new upgrades, a new level, steam achievements and a bunch of other little features while I wasn't looking. Definitely a plus, and it rips out one of my few cons about the game.

[h1]/i\Eval à chaud après 1 heure et demie de jeu(comme je vois pas d'évaluation en français... ferais une MAJ, parce que pour résumer, il me plait bien!)[/h1]

C'est un SHMUP avec un côté RPG(un tout petit peu comme "Radiant Silvergun", mais pas dans la m^me optique, j'y reviendrais) avec un scénario qui tend vers le WTF et la parodie.

Ayant un petit nombre de SHMUP à mon compteur, c'est loin d'être un bullet hell très difficile... mais c'est bien, car d'un il est très progressif dans sa difficulté et de deux, les niveaux sont bien fait de sorte à ce qu'on comprenne les mécaniques jeux et les pattern des ennemis correctement(on est pas dans le "t'as pas vu?, tu mémorise et tu recommence" cher à des SHMUP Treasure comme Radiant ou "Ikaruga"...).
Il est d'autant plus accessible que vous avez un bouclier et une barre de vie; donc on est encore plus loin du "une boulette =depuis le début soldat!".
C'est là que la partie RPG rentre en compte: l'amélioration des stats après chaque stage finalement conviendra à tout le monde, l'école du skill contre l'école du grind, si vous réussissez pas, abandonnez et farmé vos stats.

Le scénario est en mode "on s'en balec total!". N'attendez rien à part quelques sourires :)

Y a au moins une dizaine de stage(j'ai pas totalement fini la campagne), donc çà doit bien représenter 1h30 en ligne droite(ce qui est beaucoup pour un SHMUP); la question est de savoir si les autres difficultés donnent des raisons d'y retourner et si on pourra y jouer sur le long terme... je peux pas vous dire exactement.

D'autant que les devs n'ont pas encore totalement terminé leur bébé: quelques bugs(visiblement, les stats ne sont pas conservés une fois la campagne terminée) et pas de succès, ni de carte à échanger.

Peut être attendre un peu avant de le prendre... en tout cas, très bon choix pour ceux qui veulent se mettre au genre en douceur, et plutôt bonne pioche pour les autres.

19013317.review:
A game with mechs that use big guns, swords and superpowers.

What? You need more than that? Really? Oh well, fine:

SGW is a fast paced single player/co-op sidescroller shoot 'em up with light hearted humor along the way. The mechs all get a primary and secondary weapon to use(primary one being mostly something fast like a minigun and secondary something heavier like a grenade launcher) and they also have a melee attack to slash through enemies with. Every mech also gets their own distortion ability(superpower) and another special attack(like Silver Wolf can make a quick dodge dash). Several difficulties to choose from and if you aren't content with the base ones, make your own to use. There is a campaign mode where you progress through several maps, varied enemies/bosses and get upgrades along the way and then theres a gauntlet mode which goes on until you die(or get tired). Fully playable alone or with some friends, especially due to quick and easy customization of difficulty. The developers are also very responsive to feedback and are quick to fix whatever bugs or issues might come up. And the music is great.

In short:
Pros:
-custom difficulty
-great soundtrack
-quick to get into, everything is available right away
-nice and varied visuals
-funny random humor
-responsive devs
-varied weapons and mechs

Cons:
-no online multiplayer

Overall a fun and fast game, more content on the way has been mentioned already.

19005738.review:
Stardust Galaxy Warriors is a pretty amusing horizontally scrolling shoot-'em-up, with solid controls and graphics wedded to a very silly plot. Unlike a bunch of western-made mecha games, this one is less "lol, mecha cliches" and more just nonsense, which I found more entertaining and less rehashed. I mean, it's a game in which the final boss's first form is a giant disco ball.

Unfortunately, though, it's also a game with a major problem - it took me about 90 minutes to complete the campaign on the default difficulty settings, during which I only died once, and rarely came close to death on any other occasion. Unless you mess with the settings to make things very difficult on yourself, it's just ... not a difficult game, between your small hitbox, taking several hits on your armor to kill (and being able to repair that damage), having regenerating shields on top of that, and frequently being able to destroy enemies before they can pose a real threat to you, as well.

This also causes the customization system to feel kind of futile, since I never really saw any reason to play as anything but the first combination I found that I liked - the Blue Falcon with the Taranis LB-02 plasma shotgun and Mjolnir UG-08 particle beam, which I settled on pretty quickly after realizing that I didn't like the Vajra 75-ZS pulse rifle. As in, I basically completed the entire game with the second weapon set I tried, without the game ever making me think a different setup might be useful for certain stages.

As a result, I'm not entirely sure I can recommend it for its current price of $10. (Well, $9 as of this writing, due to the launch discount.) It's probably fine if you want to spend time messing with the settings to challenge yourself, or if you're just not that good at shoot-'em-up games, but ... eh. Kind of a letdown, ultimately, given how many things Vasara Entertainment got right.

18994410.review:
[I] This key was obtained from the developer for the purposes of review [/i]

[u] Summary: [/u]
Solid across the board is the name of the game with Stardust Galaxy Warriors. It's not a game that takes it self too seriously, as you fight everything from a giant talking asteroid to a giant disco ball. What stands out here is the customization and options that are available. Your weapon load outs will play to specific play styles that will do well in parts of levels but not in others, and it helps that the local co-op can play to the game's strengths in question. The customization of fire rates, enemy durability and power ups help to create an experience that can work for any player in the end, giving challenge for those SHMUP pros while scaling back the experience for those who need a little help. Also: props to the fantastic soundtrack here: it's the highlight of the game and frankly makes me recommend the soundtrack as a purchase in of itself, even if you don't like SHMUPs. Does the game's combat over time drag a tiny bit? Yes it does, but in the end, for a 10 dollar title, you can't get much better then the bang for buck that this game provides. 

[b] Gameplay Footage and Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2_rkwYRPnZg[/b]

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]+:[/b]
[list]
[*] Customization options for gameplay is one of the strongest in the genre this year, or of many SHMUP like games I've played. Customization of fire rates, enemy durability, and what power ups do makes a game that can tailor itself to you specifically, if you put the time into it. While it can screw with the balance, the default selections do a good job to balance, and it's your decision in the end. 
[*] Fantastic Soundtrack. Well worth a look by itself. 
[*] Weapon and Mech selections make a huge difference, as you can really change up your playstyle based on what your selection is. Coop choices makes a difference. 
[*] Some backgrounds are fantastic (the water level in particular). The graphics options are great for a game of this cost, and while it doesn't take every opportunity for the visual style to come through, it's pretty fantastic. 
[*] The controls are solid.
[*] The 4th wall breaking humor does the job. It's a cheesy storyline, but hey, did you expect otherwise?

[/list]

[b]-:[/b]
[list]
[*] The Gauntlet mode could use a little bit more punch in the end. It feels very similar after a couple of plays. Over time, the game does have slight trouble in variety. 
[*] Boss patterns needs a little bit more as they repeat too often. 
[*] It's hard to see the detail on the Mechs that they put on them
[*] Like other games in the genre, sometimes there's too much on the screen, and the explosions and bullets can get lost in the visuals. 
[/list]
